content.question: The velocity of a particle moving along the x-axis is given by <math> <mrow> <mi>v</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo><msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </math> for time t > 0. What is the average velocity of the particle from time t = 1 to time t = 3 ?

topic.text: 8.1: Finding the Average Value of a Function on an Interval

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
